text:
Hello people, today this live experiment is
all about rockets.

I'm going to make one of the simplest rockets
you probably seen it before.

We're just gonna have a quick look at different
things that can make it go further or not
as far.

Now a rocket, basically works by having a
propellant inside it that gets shot out in

one direction which causes the rocket to go
in the other direction.

So you can change how fast you send the propellant
out to change how fast the rocket goes.

Now there are different things you can use
for propellants, and normally on rockets they
use fuel which is combusted.

But here we're gonna use a different type
of set up.

So for this all you're gonna need is a plastic
bottle, some water, a pump, a cork, and if

the cork isn't big enough to fit into the
bottle you can stick some duct tape around

it, and also what we've got here what we've
put through the cork, is actually an inner

tube, you know the inner tube that has the
little valve coming out of it, and we've cut

the rest of the inner tube off, and what we've
been left with is this valve.

We've had to cut the cork in half to let the
valve go through.

Now if you want you can actually stick a nail
through, you can drill through, or get a screw
and screw through.

Whatever works for you just make sure you
don't screw through your hands.
So there you go.

Now, lets put them together and go and try
it out.

Right, I've got my bottle and I'm gonna send
it off.

What I've done is attach these two bits on
it just to give it a little guide as we send
it off, just some sellotape and a hose.

We can guide it off at 45 degrees so we can
see how far it goes instead of shooting it
straight up.

So I'm gonna put the water in about a quarter
full, so this is a two litre bottle so I'm
gonna put in about 500ml.

The more propellant you have the more force
it will be able to send out in this direction,
so that this goes out that way with more force.
